turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hey, I'm looking for a new game to play. I'm really into RPGs, especially ones with a good story. Any recommendations?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Certainly! For story-rich RPGs, I can recommend 'The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt' which has a mature story and tons of side quests, or 'Divinity: Original Sin 2' if you prefer turn-based combat and a high level of player agency. Would either of those be of interest?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hmm, I've played Witcher 3 already, great game! Divinity sounds interesting, but honestly, turn-based combat isn't really my thing. Anything else? I'm getting kinda frustrated trying to find something new.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Okay, understood. How about 'Kingdom Come: Deliverance'? It's a first-person RPG set in medieval Bohemia, with a focus on realism and historical accuracy. Or perhaps 'GreedFall,' a colonial-era RPG with political intrigue and supernatural elements.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, Kingdom Come sounds really cool. I have a question, though. How does the AI in that game handle large-scale battles? I've heard it can be pretty janky and break immersion. Is that true, or has it been improved over time?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: That's a valid concern. The AI in 'Kingdom Come: Deliverance,' particularly in larger battles, *did* have some issues at launch. While improvements and patches have addressed some of the initial problems, some players still report instances of AI behaving somewhat predictably or getting stuck. However, many find that the immersion and realism offered by the rest of the game outweighs these occasional shortcomings. I recommend looking at recent gameplay videos and reviews specifically addressing the AI to see if it's something you can tolerate.
